results.title: The Truth about cats and dogs
results.creator_credit: Michael Lehmann, Richard Hashimoto, Cari-Esta Albert, Noon Attack and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: When panicked photographer Brian has trouble with a disagreeable Great Dane, he calls Dr Abby Barnes (Janeane Garofalo) a radio veterinarian whose daily program helps people with their problem pets. The pair develop an instant connection over the telephone and the eager Brian invites Abby out, asking for a description of herself so he can find her in a crowd. Lacking in self-confidence, Abby describes her neigbour, best friend and model, Noelle (Uma Thurman). When Abby stands him up, Ben comes to the studio looking for answers, and happens to see Noelle. Abby explains the situation to Noelle, who agrees to take her place, while Abby assumes the character of Donna. While Abby develops a relationship with Brian over the telephone and the radio, Noelle is the woman he believes he is talking to. Things become more complicated when Noelle falls for Brian, and Brian starts to wonder why his new girlfriend seems to have two different personalities.

results.title: Kika
results.creator_credit: Pedro Almodovar, Esther Garcia, Agustin Almodovar and Ciby
results.brief_description: An intriguing web of desire, deceit and death are expertly woven together in this effervescent satire by the unrepentantly twisted director Pedro Almodovar. The madness begins with motormouth make-up artist Kika (Veronique Forque) being summoned to the home of ex-pat American writer Nicholas (Peter Coyote) to make over the corpse of his step-son, Ramon (Alex Casanovas). During her ministrations, Ramon awakens from a cataleptic trance, and the pair fall in love. Complicating their bizarre relationship further are Kika’s sporadic involvement with Nicholas, the lustful adoration of her maid, Juana (Rossy de Palma), and Ramon’s demented ex-girlfriend, Andrea Scarface (Victoria Abril), the host of the voyeuristic reality television show, `Today’s Worst’. Committed to turning private lives inside out for a scoop, Andrea zips around Madrid on a motorcycle with a camera strapped to her crash helmet. Things truly take a turn for the outrageous when Juana’s psychotic ex-porn star brother, Pablo, appears on the scene after breaking out of jail, with Andrea hot on his heels. An explicit but entertaining film filled with fabulous imagery and dazzling costumes from famous fashion designers Jean Paul Gaultier and Gianni Versace. Veronique Forque won a Goya Award for Best Lead Actress for her portrayal of Kika. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Flying leathernecks
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Ray, Edmund Grainger and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Major Dan Kirby (John Wayne) heads a marine fighter squadron in the South Pacific in 1942. The men in the squadron resent his leadership due to the fact that they expected one of their own to be promoted - and so a clash of personalities ensues. When the squadron is sent to Guadalcanal to give support to ground troops, Kirby is further hindered by a dangerous shortage of planes and pilots. Real-life footage and staged action combine to make this one of the most unforgettable war films of the 1950s.

results.title: The Bride with white hair
results.brief_description: Directed with exuberant energy by Ronnie Yu (“Bride of Chucky”), “The Bride with white hair” is a fine example of the type of genre bending movies that Hong Kong cinema is most famous for. Part Romeo and Juliet and part martial arts fantasy adventure, the film takes place in a mythic, medieval China and stars Hong Kong superstars Brigitte Lin and Leslie Cheung as members of opposing clans who fall in love and get caught in the middle of a violent feud. The film’s shamelessly romantic mood is set from the opening scene which has Cho Yi Hang (Leslie Cheung), a Wu Tang Clan sect disciple, forlornly guarding a single white rose believed to have mystical powers, while mourning the absence of his true love, Lian Nichang (Brigitte Lin), the white haired one of the title. The film then goes back ten years to tell their epic story, complete with evil siamese twins and plenty of hair extension fighting. Cast includes Francis Ng, Elaine Lu. Based on the novel by Leung Yu-Sang. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Centre stage = Yuen Ling Yuk
results.creator_credit: Stanley Kwan, Willie Chan Chi Keung, Chui Siu Ming and Paragon Films
results.brief_description: Based on the real life of Chinese silent movie star Ruan Lingyu, ‘Centre Stage’ brings back to life the golden age of the ‘Hollywood of the East’, the Lienhau studios of Shanghai in the 1930s. Ruan (Maggie Cheung) is already an established star at age 20 when her world starts to collapse. First married to an immature, pleasure seeking play boy, she obtains a costly divorce in order to set-up house with Tang Chi Shan (Tony Leung Ka-fai), a producer at Lienhua who is also a married man. Tired of playing melodramatic characters, Ruan accepts a role in film directed by an up and coming director titled ‘New Woman’. The film is a vicious attack of the Chinese press whose tabloid style is pushing a woman to destruction. The press retaliates so violently that massive cuts are ordered to appease the anger of the opinion makers. This is the time Ruan’s ex-husband re-appears and threatens to expose her as an adulteress. Ruan’s star starts to spiral down. The film blends fact and fiction, documentary and narrative. Rare footage of the real Ruan’s performances are mixed with Cheung’s re-creations of Ruan’s lost films. In a clever twist of casting, the role of Ruan, originally intended for Anita Mui (Kwan’s star in ‘Rouge’), went to Maggie Cheung. Cheung was the same age as Ruan at the time of her suicide and had had many run-ins with the Hong Kong press. Kwan blends his narrative with documentary style footage of Cheung explaining how she researched the part and interviews with Chinese cinema veterans. The result is an interrogation on cinema itself. The film won several awards, including the Silver Bear for Best Actress at the 1992 Berlin Film Festival. Also stars Carina Lau, Waise Lee, Cecilia Yip. In Cantonese with English subtitles. The film is also known as ‘The Actress’, ‘The New China Woman’ in various English releases or ‘Ruan Ling-yu’ in Mandarin.

results.title: Prison on fire
results.creator_credit: Ringo Lam, Karl Maka, Catherine Chang and Cinema City Film Production
results.brief_description: After accidentally committing a murder, a young advertising executive is sentenced to three years in prison. His clean looks and straight-forward honesty with the prison staff make him a target for the various triad factions at work in the institution, until he forms an alliance with an older prisoner who knows the ins and outs of the system. Less an action film than a drama in the prison film genre, “Prison on fire” explores themes of honour, loyalty and friendship, capturing the bleakness and despair of prison life through the drab, claustrophobic colour scheme and absence of music. Lam’s portrayal of a Chinese prison eschews the usual prison film cliches, focusing instead on how the prison environment brings out the worst in people. Cast includes Chow Yun-Fat, Tony Leung and Roy Cheung. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Full alert
results.creator_credit: Ringo Lam, Li Kuo-Hsing, Brilliant Idea Group and Young Filmmakers
results.brief_description: After the failure of his first Hollywood film, ‘Maximum Risk’, Lam returned to Hong Kong to shoot this $13 million action film. A claustrophobic police thriller set just after the handover of Hong Kong to China, ‘Full Alert’ revives the ‘film bleu’ tradition of Hong Kong cop and gangster films, its belligerent energy recalling the sense of anarchy in Hong Kong films of the eighties. Inspector Pao is a grizzled, jaded veteran cop who has seen it all in his years with the Hong Kong police. After a vicious murderer escapes to Taiwan, Pau vows to track him down. To him he represents a new kind of criminal— smart, canny, ambitious and vicious— a man who will stop at nothing to get what he wants. As in Michael Mann’s ‘Heat’ (1996) to which ‘Full Alert’ has been compared, the cop and the robber are set up as a pair of compelling twins/opposites driven to battle each other. They increasingly come to resemble each other in motive and character as the film progresses. Cast includes Lau Ching-Wan and Francis Ng. In Cantonese with English and Mandarin subtitles.

results.title: Running out of time
results.creator_credit: Johnnie To and Milky Way Image
results.brief_description: A tenacious cop pursues a jewel thief with 72 hours to live who decides to pull off one last heist. In what has become a generic convention of the Hong Kong action film, the two develop a sense of empathy and mutual respect as they engage in a series of mind games that become increasingly complicated as the narrative moves towards a final showdown. With its sparse dialogue and moody, cool cinematography, the film is markedly restrained compared to To’s earlier work. Cast includes Andy Lau and Lau Ching-Wan. In Cantonese with English subtitles.
